data.event: Before 1 April 1974 it formed part of the Whiston Rural District in Lancashire.
The area still however has a Liverpool postcode "L24" In spite of being close to the City of Liverpool, the village’s tranquil and quiet atmosphere still survives today.

event.title: present an attractive picture in the spring and summer

data.event: The many whitewashed cottages, with country gardens, set against a background of mature trees, present an attractive picture in the spring and summer.

event.title: won ‘Best - Kept Village’ awards in the late 1960s

data.event: The visitor will quickly appreciate why Hale has several times won ‘Best - Kept Village’ awards in the late 1960s and more recently several "Community Pride" and "Little Gem Awards" for several locations in the village.
